sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Solid Waste Planning and Recycling Act.
sections.text: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Solid Waste Planning and Recycling Act.

sections.heading: (a) By March 1, 1991, each county with a population of
sections.text:
100,000 or more and each municipality with a population of 1,000,000 or
more, and by March 1, 1995, each county with a population of less than
100,000, shall submit to the Agency an officially adopted plan for the
management of municipal waste generated within its boundaries. Such plan
shall conform with the waste management hierarchy established as State
policy in subsection (b) of Section 2 of the Illinois Solid Waste Management Act.

sections.heading: (a) Prior to adopting a waste management plan for submission
sections.text:
to the Agency, the county shall form an advisory committee, which shall
include representatives from municipalities within the county, citizen
organizations, industry, the private solid waste management industry
operating within the county, local recyclers and any other persons deemed
appropriate by the county. The advisory committee shall review the plan
during its preparation, make suggestions and propose any changes it believes
appropriate.

sections.heading: Each county waste management plan adopted under Section 4
sections.text: shall include a recycling program. Such recycling program:

sections.heading: (a) Each county shall begin implementation of its waste
sections.text:
management plan, including the recycling program, within one year of
adoption of the plan. The county may enter into written agreements with
other persons, including a municipality or persons transporting municipal
waste on the effective date of this Act, pursuant to which the persons
undertake to fulfill some or all of the county's responsibilities under
this Act. A person who enters into an agreement shall be responsible with
the county for the implementation of such programs.

sections.heading: Any county or municipality may, by ordinance, provide that no
sections.text:
sanitary landfill facility located within the unincorporated area, if a
county, or the incorporated area, if a municipality, may accept for final
disposal at any time truckloads composed primarily of leaves generated
within the county in which the facility is located, except that leaves separated at
the source from other municipal waste may be accepted by a
sanitary landfill facility in those instances where the facility
has provided and maintains for that purpose separate composting
facilities, and the composted leaves are utilized either as part
of the final vegetative cover for the landfill, or for other uses
as a soil conditioning material.

sections.heading: Regulation of certain pollution control facilities
sections.text: No provision of this Act shall be construed to allow any county with a population of less than 2,000,000 residents to adopt an ordinance or resolution, except an ordinance or resolution adopting a county plan in accordance with Sections 4 and 5 o

sections.heading: Beginning January 1, 1992, no person shall offer for
sections.text:
sale any single use plastic bottle with a capacity of 16 fluid ounces or
more, nor any other single use rigid plastic container
with a capacity of 8 fluid ounces or more, that is not coded in a manner that
assists recyclers in sorting such containers by resin composition. The
code shall consist of a 3-sided triangular arrow with a number in the
center and letters underneath. The number and letters shall indicate the
resin from which the container is made as follows: 1 and PETE for
polyethylene terephthalate, 2 and HDPE for high density polyethylene, 3 and
V for vinyl, 4 and LDPE for low density polyethylene, 5 and PP for
polypropylene, 6 and PS for polystyrene, and 7 and Other for other
materials, including multi-layer materials. Containers with labels or base
cups of different material shall be coded by their primary, basic material.
However, this Section does not apply to the plastic casings
on lead-acid storage batteries.

sections.heading: (a) Any person that violates any provision of this Act shall
sections.text:

such penalty may, upon order of a court of competent jurisdiction, be made
